Finance}} | intl = | bodystyle = }} '''Gentiva Health Services''' is the largest provider of [[home care|home health care]], [[hospice]] and related services in the [[United States]]. Gentiva is based in [[Atlanta, Georgia]]. It is a [[Fortune 1000]] company with over $1.7 billion in annual revenue. Gentiva is a member of the [[S&P 600]] index, developed by [[Standard & Poor's]], featuring small capitalization U.S.-based stocks. The company offers a range of services, including [[nursing]], [[physical therapy|physical]], [[occupational therapy|occupational]], and [[speech and language pathology|speech-language therapy]], [[cardiology|cardiac]] and [[pulmonology|pulmonary care]], [[disease management (health)|disease]] and [[pain management|pain]] management, and other health and medical services. Gentiva provides [[health services]] to over half a million patients annually{{cite web|title=Company Profile - Gentiva|url=http://nslpn.com/senior-care-jobs/employer/company/481/gentiva|publisher=National Senior Living Partners Network}} through over 420 U.S. locations in 40 states.{{cite web|title=Gentiva Health Services Inc (GTIV.O)|url=https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/companyProfile?symbol=GTIV.O|publisher=Reuters}} Its companies include Donelson, Emerald Coast, Gilbert's, Healthfield Group, Hospice of Charleston, Lazarus House, Tar Heel, Total Care and Wiregrass. ==History== Gentiva Health Services was founded on August 6, 1999, when Olsten Corporation split off its healthcare assets to form an independent, public company. Olsten Corporation was founded in 1946 by William Olsten. The company grew through the 50s, 60s, and 70s, and in 1971, it began focusing on its health care division under the name Olsten Healthcare. In the 90s its health care division began acquiring other companies. The division acquired Upjohn Health Services, and after an acquisition of Lifetime Corporation, which included Office Angels, it became the largest provider of home healthcare services, operating as Olsten Kimberly QualityCare. In 1995 Olsten Kimberly QualityCare launched CareCentrix, and a year later, the company entered the home infusion business by acquiring Quantum Health Resources.{{cite web|title=Gentiva Health Services, Inc. - Company Profile, Information, Business Description, History, Background Information on Gentiva Health Services, Inc.|url=http://www.referenceforbusiness.com/history2/48/Gentiva-Health-Services-Inc.html#ixzz2sSwibpaw|publisher=Reference for Business}} That same year it acquired NeuroCare Rehab Without Walls, and became the sole national provider for Cigna HealthCare. It also acquired Nurses House Call, and in 1997, it changed its name to Olsten Health Services. In 1999, Olsten Corporation split its healthcare division into an independent, publicly traded company, named Gentiva Health Services. In its first three years of independent operation, Gentiva launched its Gentiva Orthopedics, Gentiva Cardiopulmonary, and Safe Strides programs, it also sold its pharmaceutical services division to [[Accredo Health Inc.]]{{cite web|title=Gentiva Makes $415M Deal|url=http://www.newsday.com/business/technology/gentiva-makes-415m-deal-1.458421|publisher=Newsday}}{{cite web|url=http://edgar.secdatabase.com/1237/95016202000028/filing-main.htm |title=Gentiva Health Services, Form 8-K, Current Report, Filing Date Jan 7, 2002 |publisher=secdatabase.com |accessdate =May 14, 2018}} It also sold its health care staffing unit to InteliStaf Holdings Inc. and the Carlyle Group.{{cite web|title=Gentiva Health Services to Sell Staffing Unit|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/08/26/business/company-news-gentiva-health-services-to-sell-staffing-unit.html|publisher=The New York Times}} By 2010, it had acquired First HomeCare of Houston, Heritage Home Care Services, The Healthfield Group, Gilbert's Home Health and Hospice, Physicians Home Health Care and Hospice of Charleston. In 2008, it launched its Neurorehabilitation and Senior Health programs. In 2009, Gentiva moved its headquarters from [[Melville, New York]] to [[Atlanta, Georgia]]. In that same year, it acquired Mid-State Home Health, Magna Home Health, and Medicare-Certified offices of Coordinated Home HealthCare. In 2011, the company sold its majority stake in CareCentrix to Water Street Healthcare Partners.{{cite web|title=Gentiva to Separate CareCentrix Unit; Focus Exclusively on Home Care Operations |url=http://investors.gentiva.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=329351 |publisher=Gentiva |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222012236/http://investors.gentiva.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=329351 |archivedate=2014-02-22 |df= }} Also in 2011, the company closed or divested 34 home health branches and 9 hospice branches. It also sold its IDOA business to Premier Home Health Care Services, acquired [[Odyssey Healthcare]] of Augusta,{{cite web|title=Gentiva to buy hospice care firm for $1 billion|url=http://dealbook.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/05/24/gentiva-to-buy-hospice-care-firm-for-1-billion/?src=busln|publisher=The New York Times}} and sold its Rehab Without Walls business to Southern Home Care Services. Its $1 billion purchase of Odyssey Healthcare was the largest hospice acquisition in U.S. history.{{cite web|last1=Hallman|first1=Ben|title=Hospice, Inc.|url=http://projects.huffingtonpost.com/hospice-inc|publisher=Huffington Post|accessdate=24 March 2015|date=19 June 2014}} In 2012, it acquired Advocate Hospice, Family Home Care Corporation and North Mississippi Hospice. In October 2013, the company acquired Harden Healthcare Holdings and Hope Hospice.{{cite web|title=The History of Gentiva|url=https://gentivacareers.silkroad.com/gentivaext/About_Us/Company_History.html|publisher=Gentiva-History}} On October 9, 2014, Kindred Healthcare, Inc. and Gentiva Health Services, Inc. announced that the companies entered into a definitive merger agreement under which Kindred would acquire all of the outstanding shares of Gentiva common stock for $19.50 per share in a combination of cash and stock. The agreement was unanimously approved by the boards of directors of both companies. Under the terms of the agreement, Gentiva shareholders will receive $14.50 per share in cash and $5.00 of Kindred common stock (which equates to 0.257 shares of Kindred common stock based upon an agreed upon fixed exchange ratio). The transaction is valued at $1.8 billion, including the assumption of net debt.{{cite web |title=Kindred and Gentiva Reach Definitive Agreement |url=http://investors.gentiva.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=875404 |publisher=Gentiva |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141012203504/http://investors.gentiva.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=875404 |archivedate=2014-10-12 |df= }} The deal was officially signed into agreement effective January 31, 2015, with Gentiva becoming a wholly owned subsidiary of Kindred. ==Divisions== ===Home Health=== The Home Health division consists of direct home nursing and therapy services operations, including specialty programs and its consulting business. As of December 31, 2011, the Home Health segment conducted its business through more than 270 locations located in 39 states. The division is separated into five geographical regions, which are further separated into geographical operating areas. Each operating area includes branch locations, through which home healthcare agencies operate. The division offers a number of individualized home programs that are used to care for patients, by providing therapy and rehabilitation, as well as support to allow a patient to stay in their home. These programs include Gentiva Orthopedics, Gentiva Safe Strides, Gentiva Cardiopulmonary, Gentiva Neurorehabilitation, and Gentiva Senior Health. In addition the division provides consulting services to home health agencies, which include operational support, billing and collection activities, as well as on-site agency support and consulting. ===Hospice=== The Hospice division serves terminally ill patients and their families through more than 150 locations operating in 29 states. The division is separated into five geographic regions, which in turn are further separated into geographic operating areas, each of which includes branch locations. Depending on a patient’s needs, each hospice patient is assigned an interdisciplinary team consisting of a physician, nurse(s), home health aide(s), medical social worker(s), chaplain, dietary counselor and bereavement coordinator, as well as other care professionals. Hospice services are provided primarily in the patient’s home or other residence, such as an assisted living residence or nursing home, or in a hospital. The Hospice division also offers individualized programs that include a dementia specialty program, a cancer specialty program, a cardiac specialty program, and a pulmonary specialty program. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.gentiva.com Gentiva Health Services Official Web Site]. *[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C06E5DE153DF931A15756C0A9679C8B63 "Gentiva to Appeal Ruling"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 22, 2001. *[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9804E0DA1138F933A25754C0A9679C8B63 "City Plans Home Health Contract for Company Renamed After Fraud"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', July 10, 2001. *[http://libn.com/2001/11/16/feds-conclude-investigation-of-payments-to-gentiva/ "Feds Conclude Investigation of Payments to Gentiva"], ''Long Island Business News'', November [[Category:Companies based in Atlanta]] [[Category:Companies based in Suffolk County, New York]] [[Category:Health care companies established in 1999]] [[Category:Health care companies based in Georgia (US State)]] [[Category:1999 establishments in Georgia (U.S. state)]] [[Category:Medical outsourcing companies of the United States]]

{{Infobox book | name = Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... and Others Don't | title_orig = | translator = | image = Cover Good 2 Gr8.jpg | image_size = 150px | caption = Front cover | author = [[Jim C. Collins]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United States | language = [[English language|English]] | series = | subject = Corporate strategy | genre = Non-fiction | publisher = [[William Collins (publisher)|William Collins]] | release_date = October 16, 2001 | english_release_date = | media_type = [[Hardcover]] | pages = 320 | isbn = 978-0-06-662099-2 | dewey = 658 21 | congress = HD57.7 .C645 2001 | oclc = 46835556 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... and Others Don't''''' is a management book by [[Jim C. Collins]] that describes how companies transition from being good companies to great companies, and how most companies fail to make the transition. The book was published on October 16, 2001. "Greatness" is defined as financial performance several multiples better than the market average over a sustained period. Using tough benchmarks, Collins and his research team identified a set of elite companies that made the leap to great results and sustained those results for at least fifteen years. How great? After the leap, the good-to-great companies generated cumulative stock returns that beat the general stock market by an average of seven times in fifteen years, better than twice the results delivered by a composite index of the world's greatest companies, including Coca-Cola, Intel, General Electric, and Merck. Collins finds the main reason certain companies become great is they narrowly focus the company’s resources on their field of key competence.
The book was a bestseller, selling four million copies and going far beyond the traditional audience of business books.<ref>{{cite news|last=Bryant|first=Adam|title=For This Guru, No Question Is Too Big|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/05/24/business/24collins.html?_r=1&pagewanted=all|newspaper=New York Times|date=May 23, 2009}}</ref>
==Writing== Collins used a large team of researchers who studied "6,000 articles, generated more than 2,000 pages of interview transcripts and created 384 megabytes of computer data in a five-year project".<ref name=pw/> Top members of this research team were:
* Brian J.Bagley * Lane Hornung * Vicki Mosur Osgood * Scott Cederberg * Christine Jones * Alyson Sinclair * Anthony J.Chirikos * Scott Jones * Peter Van Genderen * Jenni Cooper * Stefanie A.Judd * Paul Weissman * Duane C.Duffy * Brian C.Larsen * Leigh Wilbanks * Eric Hagen * Weijia (Eve) Li * Amber L.Young * Morten T.Hansen * Nicholas M.Osgood
==Seven characteristics of companies that went from "good to great"== * Level 5 Leadership: Leaders who are humble, but driven to do what's best for the company. * First Who, Then What: Get the right people on the bus, then figure out where to go. Find the right people and try them out in different seats on the bus (different positions in the company). * Confront the Brutal Facts: The [[Stockdale paradox]]—Confront the brutal truth of the situation, yet at the same time, never give up hope. * Hedgehog Concept: Three overlapping circles: What lights your fire ("passion")? What could you be best in the world at ("best at")? What makes you money ("driving resource")? * Culture of Discipline: Rinsing the cottage cheese. * Technology Accelerators: Using technology to accelerate growth, within the three circles of the hedgehog concept. * The Flywheel: The additive effect of many small initiatives; they act on each other like compound interest.
==Great companies== Collins finds eleven examples of "great companies" and comparators, similar in industry-type and opportunity, but which failed to achieve the good-to-great growth shown in the great companies:
{| |+ | '''Great Company''' || '''Comparator''' |- | [[Abbott Laboratories]] || [[Upjohn]] |- | [[Circuit City Stores]] || [[Silo (store)|Silo]] |- | [[Fannie Mae]] || [[Great Western Bank]] |- | [[Gillette (brand)|Gillette Company]] (now a [[Procter & Gamble]] brand) || [[Warner-Lambert|Warner-Lambert Co]] |- | [[Kimberly-Clark]] || [[Scott Paper Company]] |- | [[Kroger]] || [[The Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company|A&P]] (declared [[Bankruptcy in the United States|bankruptcy]] in 2010 and 2015; all supermarkets sold or shut down in 2015) |- | [[Nucor]] || [[Bethlehem Steel]] |- | [[Altria Group|Philip Morris]] || [[R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company|R. J. Reynolds]] |- | [[Pitney Bowes]] || [[Addressograph]] |- | [[Walgreens]] || [[Eckerd Corporation|Eckerd]] |- | [[Wells Fargo]] || [[Bank of America]] |}
==Unsustained Companies== Collins includes 6 examples of companies that did not sustain their change to greatness. These companies, "... are looked at separately as a clump":<ref>http://www.audiobooks.com/audiobook/good-to-great-why-some-companies-make-the-leap-and-others-dont/83046</ref>
{| |+ | '''Unsustained Comparisons''' |- | [[Burroughs Corporation|Burroughs]] |- | [[Chrysler]] |- | [[Harris Corporation|Harris]] |- | [[Hasbro]] |- | [[Rubbermaid]] |- | [[Teledyne]] |}
==Response== The book was "cited by several members of [[The Wall Street Journal]]'s CEO Council as the best management book they've read."<ref>{{cite book | author=Alan Murray | title=The Wall Street Journal Essential Guide to Management | publisher=New York: HarperCollins | year=2010 | pages=11 | isbn=978-0-06-184033-3}}</ref>
''[[Publishers Weekly]]'' called it "worthwhile", although "many of Collins' perspectives on running a business are amazingly simple and commonsense".<ref name=pw>{{cite news|title=GOOD TO GREAT: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... And Others Don't (Review)|url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/978-0-06-662099-2|accessdate=2012-07-13|date=September 3, 2001}}</ref> Similarly Holt and Cameron state the book provides a "generic business recipe" that ignores "particular strategic opportunities and challenges."<ref name=CultStrat>{{cite book |last=Holt |first=Douglas |last2=Cameron |first2=Douglas |year=2010 |title=Cultural Strategy |publisher=Oxford University Press |isbn=978-0-19-958740-7}}</ref>
[[Steven D. Levitt]] noted that some of the companies selected as "great" have since gotten into serious trouble, such as [[Circuit City]] and [[Fannie Mae]], while only [[Nucor]] had "dramatically outperformed the stock market" and "Abbott Labs and Wells Fargo have done okay". He further states that investing in the portfolio of the 11 companies covered by the book, in the year of 2001, would actually result in ''underperforming'' the [[S&P 500]].<ref>http://blog.asmartbear.com/business-advice-plagued-by-survivor-bias.html</ref> Levitt concludes that books like this are "mostly backward-looking" and can't offer a guide for the future."<ref>{{cite web|last=Levitt|first=Steven D.|title=From Good to Great … to Below Average|url=http://www.freakonomics.com/2008/07/28/from-good-to-great-to-below-average/|work=Freakonomics|date=2008-07-28}}</ref>
Collins reaffirmed that "The books never promised that these companies would always be great, just that they were once great."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inc.com/by-the-book/2009/09/paranoia_your_best_friend.html|date=September 14, 2009|title=Paranoia: Your Best Friend|author=Clint Greenleaf|publisher=''[[Inc. (magazine)]]''|accessdate=2015-07-17}}</ref>

{{eastern name order|Bajnai György Gordon}} {{Infobox Officeholder | name = Gordon Bajnai | image =Bajnai Jerusalem.jpg | office = [[Prime Minister of Hungary]] | president = [[László Sólyom]] | term_start = 14 April 2009 | term_end = 29 May 2010 | predecessor = [[Ferenc Gyurcsány]] | successor = [[Viktor Orbán]] | office1 = Minister of National Development and Economy | primeminister1=[[Ferenc Gyurcsány]] | term_start1 = 15 May 2008 | term_end1= 14 April 2009 | predecessor1= [[Csaba Kákosy]] | successor1 = [[István Varga (politician, born 1956)|István Varga]] | office2 = Minister of Local Government and Regional Development | term_start2 = 1 July 2007 | term_end2 = 14 May 2008 | predecessor2= [[Mónika Lamperth]] | successor2 = [[István Gyenesei]] | primeminister2=[[Ferenc Gyurcsány]] | office4 = [[Parliament of Hungary|Member of the National Assembly]] | term_start4 = 6 May 2014 | term_end4 = 26 May 2014 | birth_name = György Gordon Bajnai | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1968|3|5|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Szeged]], [[People's Republic of Hungary|Hungary]] | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = Andrea Izsák (1st)
Mónika Hajdú (2nd) | children = {{hlist|Zsófia|Ágnes Katalin|András|Miklós}} | party = [[Together (Hungary)|Together]] | profession = [[Economist]] | alma_mater = [[Corvinus University of Budapest|Budapest University of Economic Sciences]] (now Corvinus University of Budapest) }} '''György Gordon Bajnai''' ({{IPA-hu|ˈɡordon ˈbɒjnɒi|pron}}; born 5 March 1968) is a Hungarian entrepreneur and economist, who served as the [[Prime Minister of Hungary]] from 2009 to 2010. Prior to that, he functioned as Minister of Local Government and Regional Development from 2007 to 2008, then as Minister of National Development and Economy from 2008 to 2009. In March 2009, following Prime Minister [[Ferenc Gyurcsány]]'s announced resignation, Bajnai was nominated by the ruling [[Hungarian Socialist Party]] (MSZP) to become Hungary's next head of government.{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB123840402537769209|title=Hungary's Ruling Party Picks Premier|author=Edith Balazs and Charles Forelle|date=31 March 2009|work=WSJ|accessdate=14 February 2015}} Bajnai became prime minister when the parliament passed a constructive motion of no-confidence against Ferenc Gyurcsány on 14 April 2009.{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7972214.stm|title=BBC NEWS - Europe - Hungary parties back Bajnai as PM|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}} He held the office until the formation of the [[Second Orbán Government]] following the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2010|2010 parliamentary election]]. Returning to politics, Bajnai established [[Together (Hungary)|Together 2014]], a coalition of left-wing and liberal political movements and civil organizations, in October 2012. The movement would have been an umbrella organization of centre-left parties to contrast Orbán's [[Fidesz]] in the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2014|2014 parliamentary election]] with Bajnai as its prime minister-candidate, but negotiations have failed with the other opposition parties. Thereafter, the Together movement transformed itself into party on 8 March 2013, and Bajnai had gradually marginalized in the upcoming months. He retired from politics after the 2014 national and European Parliament elections. == Studies and student politics == Bajnai was born in [[Szeged]] and raised in [[Baja, Hungary]], the son of György László Bajnai and Ágota Sóvári.[http://www.pesterlloyd.net/html/1326federvieh.html Politisiertes Federvieh – Hat Ungarn nur die Wahl zwischen “linker” und “rechter” Mafia?] Pester Lloyd / 26 - 2013, Politik 26.06.2013 He finished his secondary studies at the local [[Béla III High School]] in 1986. He graduated from the [[Budapest University of Economic Sciences]] (now Corvinus University) International Relations Department in 1991. For his public and professional activities he was rewarded Pro Universitate Award.{{cite web |accessdate=2014-01-15|url=http://www.demokrata.hu/ujsagcikk/a_csodbiztos_a_bajnai_gordon_sztori___resz/|title=A csődbiztos - A Bajnai Gordon-sztori 1. rész|date=2008-06-18}} Bajnai was very active in student-politics. In 1987, he organized a boycott of the University of Economics' canteen, and was the first chairman of the Independent Student Council.[http://www.nol.hu/archivum/archiv-469903 Antipolitikus politikus - Bajnai Gordon politikai portréja - A Political Capital elemzése], nol.hu He was also the head of the History Department of Studium Generale, Admission Preparatory Studies College. In 1989, he, alongside [[András Schiffer]], participated in the establishment of the short-lived New Generation Movement (ÚNM), founded and led by [[Ferenc Gyurcsány]].{{cite web|url=http://index.hu/gazdasag/magyar/bajn060623/|title=Index - Gazdaság - Bajnai Gordon: A politika a legösszetettebb hivatás|author=Dudás Gergely|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}} == Entrepreneurial career == After earning his [[master's degree]], Bajnai took a job at Creditum Financial Consulting Ltd. In 1993, he undertook an internship at the [[European Bank for Reconstruction and Development]] in London. Later he also worked for Eurocorp International Finance Ltd.Bajnai Gordon Between 1995 and 2000, Bajnai was the managing director of CA IB Securities Co., and was the Deputy Chief Executive Officer (at the same time when [[András Simor]], later head of [[National Bank of Hungary]], was the head of the company). Bajnai was leading, among others the IPO's of [[Richter Gedeon Co.|Gedeon-Richter]], [[MOL Group|MOL]], [[OTP Bank|OTP]], [[Magyar Telekom]], as well as some of the major [[M&A]] transactions of this period. {{cite news | url = http://www.doksi.hu/faces.php?order=DisplayFace&id=427 | title = Bajnai György Gordon (1968 - napjainkig) | publisher = doksi.hu | date = | accessdate = 2014-01-15}} Between 2000 and 2005, he was CEO of Wallis Rt., an investment company. His duty was to restructure the holding-company, make it more efficient and to manage its investments. Wallis group member companies were at that time Graboplast Rt., Rába Rt., Elender Rt., Index.hu, WING, Wallis Auto Holding, Danubius Radio, Café Advertistment. In 2003, the National Association of Managers awarded Bajnai as the "Young Manager of the Year". Among the more than 100 Wallis-owned companies a poultry processing firm, Hajdú-Bét went bankrupt during 2003, against all efforts by its management and owners. Many partners of Hajdú-Bét suffered serious losses during the time when the poultry market collapsed in 2003, Wallis group itself lost 10 billion forints (over 40 million Euros). Years later, when he started his political career, Bajnai was criticized for the Hajdú-Bét collapse, although won all the lawsuits against media-outlets for false accusations.{{cite web|url=http://index.hu/politika/belfold/baj627p/|title=Index - Belföld - Bajnai Gordon visszaszól|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.origo.hu/itthon/20060703penzukert.html|title=A képviselők irodaházánál tüntettek a Hajdú-Bét károsultjai|author=ORIGO|work=origo.hu/|accessdate=14 February 2015}} In 2005, he was Chairman of [[Budapest Airport]] (on behalf of [[BAA PLC|BAA]]), and member of the Supervisory Committee at [[Zwack]] Inc. He was a member of the Corvinus University of Budapest Economic Council. He resigned all of his company posts and board-memberships, when he entered the government as government commissioner, responsible for EU funds and national development. == Political career == === Member of the Gyurcsány II Cabinet === Bajnai first received a government post in 2006. On 1 July, Prime Minister Ferenc Gyurcsány's called on him to be the Government Commissioner for Development Policy. In this position, he was overseeing the National Development Agency, that controls EU Funds to Hungary.{{cite web |accessdate=2014-01-15|url=http://index.hu/gazdasag/magyar/8k060707/|title=Bajnai Gordon szétoszt 8000 milliárd forintot|date=2006-07-07}} He became minister in July 2007, in the Ministry of Local Government and Regional Development. After [[SZDSZ]] left the coalition government, in May 2008, he took over the newly formed Ministry of National Development and Economy. During his period as Minister, Hungary has won the right to host the [[European Institute of Innovation and Technology]], and at the same time [[Mercedes-Benz|Mercedes]] has concluded a major FDI with the Hungarian Government in Kecskemét. From October 2008, Bajnai's activities had mainly focused on managing the evolving crisis in the real economy in Hungary.{{cite web |accessdate=2014-01-15|url=http://www.origo.hu/itthon/20090402-bajnai-gordon-tevekenysege-miniszteri-hivatali-ideje-alatt.html|title=Válság, adósság és az EU közt lavírozott Bajnai|date=2009-04-03}} In March 2009, Prime Minister Ferenc Gyurcsány resigned, announcing that he would hand over his position to a new premier with a higher support of the parties of the Hungarian Parliament.{{cite news | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/22/world/22hungary.html?hp | work=The New York Times | title=Hungary's Premier Offers to Resign | first=Nicholas | last=Kulish | date=22 March 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/03/21/hungary.pm/index.html|title=Hungarian PM offers to step down|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}} The [[Alliance of Free Democrats]] (SZDSZ) opposed most candidates for the post proposed by the Hungarian Socialists. Although Bajnai was reluctant to give in, after a week, with no tangible results in sight, and being asked by the majority of party stakeholders, who also assured him of their support of the needed austerity measures, he took the job. Securing the backing of both parties, Bajnai became prime minister on 14 April 2009. === Prime Minister === {{Further|Cabinet of Gordon Bajnai}} [[File:GeithnerBajnai 2009.jpg|thumb|right|Bajnai met with [[United States Secretary of the Treasury|U.S. Secretary]] [[Timothy Geithner]] on 4 December 2009]] The Hungarian [[Hungarian National Assembly|Parliament]] elected Bajnai as Hungary's Prime Minister with 204 votes for, 8 abstentions. The remaining 174 MPs did not vote. In his first speech as PM, he promised drastic measures to stop the negative spiral of the Hungarian economy, and to ease the burden of the international crisis. He also stated that he would remain in power until he had the solid majority of Parliament behind his austerity package, but will stay no longer than a year.{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/ca031bec-b468-11de-bec8-00144feab49a.html?nclick_check=1|title=Hungary remains vulnerable to turmoil, says PM|work=Financial Times|accessdate=14 February 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/15840232?video=1157854921&play=1|title=EU Pledged Support for Latvia: Hungary PM|website=CNBC}} He did not want to nominate himself on [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2010|the next election]]; he undertook the task for only a year. [[Attila Mesterházy]] became the Hungarian Socialist Party's candidate for the position. The MSZP suffered its worst result since the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 1990|1990 elections]]. The sixth [[National Assembly of Hungary]] formed on 14 May 2010. In accordance with the [[Constitution of Hungary]] Bajnai became "acting Prime Minister" for the following days. In his last speech he raised word against the [[Jobbik]] fearing for democracy given the party's radical views.{{cite web|url=http://www.blikk.hu/blikk_aktualis/vona-gardemellenyben-tett-eskut-2018558|title=Vona gárdemellényben tett esküt|work=blikk.hu/|accessdate=14 February 2015}} The new cabinet formed on 29 May 2010. Bajnai was succeeded by [[Viktor Orbán]]. After that he retired from politics and returned to business life. ====Economic policy==== [[File:Papandreou and Bajnai 2010.jpg|thumb|left|Greek PM [[George Papandreou]] with Bajnai in March 2010]] Bajnai took over an economy that was expected to contract by 6 percent in 2009 and was kept afloat by a $25.1 billion IMF-led lifeline. Foreign investors were declining to finance Hungary's high budget and then current account deficits, and the forint's weakness threatened hundreds of thousands of families who took out foreign currency mortgages. Bajnai must have had to cut spending to rescue the budget, keep within IMF guidelines and regain investor confidence.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/20/world/europe/20iht-hungary.html?_r=1|title=In Hungary, Potential Lessons for Greece|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}} The [[Cabinet of Gordon Bajnai|Bajnai government]] had four main goals: * Immediate crisis management (Activities: Stabilization of the financial system, Safeguarding jobs, supporting those who lose their jobs, Programmes to help the financing of SMS’s; Accelerating absorption of EU funds) * Stimulating economic growth (Activities: Reforming the tax system; Extra-budgetary regulations; Extra-Measures to increase activity) * Balancing the economy (Activities: Measures for the sustainable operation of the public sector; Improving the sustainability of the pension system; Creating a more targeted social system) * Restoring Global trust (Activities: Restoring public order and confidence; Restoring confidence; Solidarity:state, politics, wealthy people; Anti-corruption measures; Helping pensioners; Providing continuous information to the public on Government activities; Establishing a national crisis Fund to help the most needy) Handling the ruling Socialists might have been his most difficult task. He needed their votes but a sizeable section of the party viewed Bajnai with contempt because cuts in welfare spending was seen as eroding the party's traditional voter base. Despite this, Bajnai made a reform in taxes, pensions, public sector bonuses, maternity support, mortgage subsidies, energy subsidies and public transport subsidies. Within six months, he managed to present a new budget that reduced government spending by five percent of [[GDP]]. Hungarian economic policy has regained its credibility, CDS-spread was less than one third of the level of a year before. In an interview given to Handelsblatt, Bajnai said: “Most of the painful decisions were taken during the first 100 days of my government” (…)“It was clear what Hungary had to do, even if it was not easy politically. (…) This required painful adjustments from the people. Our challenge was keeping things bearable while simultaneously creating better conditions for stable and sustainable development. We have accomplished that goal.”{{cite web|url=http://www.nrc.nl/international/europe/article2520313.ece/Pulling_Hungary_back_from_the_precipice|title=Pulling Hungary back from the precipice|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}} ====Foreign policy==== His first visit abroad was in Brussels, where he debuted as Prime Minister. He had discussions with [[Jose Manuel Durao Barroso]], President of the European Commission, and with [[Jaap de Hoop Scheffer]], Secretary-General of [[NATO]]. [[File:I.brüssz.JPG|thumb|left|Gordon Bajnai with Barroso in Brussels.]] In April he met with Austrian PM [[Werner Faymann]], in May, he attended the EU Partnership Summit in Prague. In May, he presented a speech on the Europe Forum, in Wachau, and in June, he attended the V4 summit in Kraków. He made a two-day official visit to [[Israel]], where he met [[Shimon Peres]], [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] and the Opposition Leader, [[Tzipi Livni]]. He also visited the [[Palestinian Authority]], where he met the Palestinian prime minister, [[Salam Fayyad]]. The Nabucco pipeline's intergovernmental agreement between [[Turkey]], [[Romania]], [[Bulgaria]], Hungary and Austria was signed by five Prime Ministers (including Bajnai) on 13 July 2009 in Ankara. {{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/8147053.stm | title = Europe gas pipeline deal agreed | publisher = [[BBC News]] | date = 2009-07-13 | accessdate = 2009-07-13}} On 19 August, he met with [[Angela Merkel]], Chancellor of Germany, in Sopron. The event was the 20th anniversary of the [[Pan-European Picnic]]. In September he made a short official visit to Finland, where amongst others he met Prime Minister [[Matti Vanhanen]]. [[File:Wachajó.JPG|thumb|right|Gordon Bajnai presenting a speech in Wachau]] On 10 September, he invited the Slovak PM [[Robert Fico]] to ease the tensions between Hungary and [[Slovakia]]. There were a clash of views between the two neighbors concerning the controversial amendment of the Slovak State Language Act. The two premiers expressed regret over the circumstances of a failed visit by President [[László Sólyom]] to [[Komárno]] on 21 August and agreed to accept all recommendations of the [[Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]] high commissioner on national minorities. Prime Ministers Gordon Bajnai of Hungary and Robert Fico of Slovakia signed a joint statement during their meeting in [[Szécsény]]. Published on the [[Hungarian government]] spokesman's website, the statement declares the two countries' common interest in easing political tension. Bajnai and Fico agreed to direct the attention of all political parties to the social risks of confrontation, and called upon the citizens of both countries to show tolerance and understanding. They agreed to take resolute measures against extremist groups, and fight against all forms of [[xenophobia]], intolerance, [[chauvinism]], nationalism and violence, and the exportation thereof to one another's country. The two premiers declared that bilateral relations should be based on confidence, transparency and a pragmatic and constructive bilateral dialogue. They agreed to use all forms and instruments of cooperation, including further prime ministerial meetings. {{cite news | url = http://www.budapesttimes.hu/content/view/12929/27/ | title = Hungarian, Slovak PMs adopt joint statement | publisher = [[The Budapest Times]] | date = 2009-09-10 | accessdate = 2009-09-10}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} [[File:Gordon Bajnai with Obamas.jpg|thumb|left|Bajnai with [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Barack Obama]] and [[First Lady of the United States|U.S. First Lady]] [[Michelle Obama]].]] Between 20–24 September, Bajnai made an official visit to the USA, where he met President [[Barack Obama]], the [[UN]] secretary general [[Ban Ki-Moon]], he attended the Climate Conference of the UN. He visited ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'''s editorial office. Amongst others he had discussions with [[George Soros]], [[Charles Gati]], and major U.S. financiers and investors, he closed the day's trading at the [[New York Stock Exchange]]. {{cite news | url = http://www.origo.hu/nagyvilag/20090924-bajnai-obama-halas-magyarorszag-kiallasaert.html | title = Bajnai szerint Obama hálás Magyarországnak | publisher = Origo.hu | date = 2009-09-24 | accessdate = 2014-01-15}} In early October, Bajnai made a visit to the United Kingdom. He attended talks with [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] [[Gordon Brown]] and gave a public lecture at the [[London School of Economics and Political Science]]. Between 18–19 October, he made a short official visit to Paris, where he met president of France [[Nicolas Sarkozy]], PM [[François Fillon]], and many French investors. Hungary sent more troops to [[Afghanistan]] in line with then current US strategy to enhance involvement there, Bajnai announced at a meeting with US Vice President [[Joe Biden]] in the [[White House]] on 4 December 2009. The pledge been made in several steps during 2010: Hungarian troops mainly serve in logistics and training operations, on top of helping to secure elections in Afghanistan, Bajnai told journalists after the talks. {{cite news | url = http://index.hu/kulfold/2009/12/04/ketszaz_ujabb_katonat_kuldunk_afganisztanba/ | title = Kétszáz újabb katonát küldünk Afganisztánba | publisher = [[Index.hu]] | date = 2009-12-04 | accessdate = 2014-01-15}} At the beginning of 2010, Bajnai, as the Chairman of the [[Visegrád Four|Visegrád Four Grouping]] has invited ten countries from the [[Central and Eastern Europe|CEE]] region to sign a declaration for the support for stronger European energy policy cooperation and enhanced security of supply.{{cite web|url=https://www.neweurope.eu/article/visegrad-four-discuss-energy-cooperation-budapest-summit/|title=Visegrad Four discuss energy cooperation at Budapest summit|date=1 March 2010|publisher=}} === Together 2014 === [[File:Műegyetem rakpart október 23 148.JPG|thumb|right|Gordon Bajnai giving a speech in October 2013]] Several months after retiring from public service, he founded the Patriotism and Progress Public Policy Foundation with some of his former government members and independent experts, which states on its website that its goal is "to shape the world view and attitudes of our citizens to build a better Hungary". "To realize this dream we will actively pursue a progressive agenda by learning from best practice and empowering communities to better themselves. We will amass and tutor the expertise and know-how to assist Hungary in facing the many tests it has to pass on the road to modernization."http://www.hazaeshaladas.hu/ During the Autumn of 2011 he became adjunct professor at [[School of International and Public Affairs|SIPA]] Columbia University in New York, and held lectures and speeches at Rutgers University in New Jersey, Johns Hopkins University in Washington D.C., Princeton University, Harvard University and the University of Pennsylvania.{{cite web|url=http://www.politics.hu/20110413/bajnais-office-confirms-former-pm-moving-to-new-york-for-two-months/|title=Bajnai’s office confirms former PM moving to New York for two months|work=Politics.hu|accessdate=14 February 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://business.rutgers.edu/events/2011/10/13/politics-eurozone-crisis|title=The Politics of the Eurozone Crisis|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}} Bajnai announced his return to politics on 23 October 2012, during the anti-government demonstration of the One Million for Press Freedom (Milla).{{cite web|url=http://www.politics.hu/20121009/bajnai-said-to-announce-return-to-politics-on-october-23/|title=Bajnai said to announce return to politics on October 23|work=Politics.hu|accessdate=14 February 2015}} On the protest, he called for an anti-Orbán coalition so as to form a supermajority in Parliament with the help of which the changes done by Orbán's ruling party, Fidesz could be undone. In his speech, Gordon Bajnai repeatedly used a variant of the term ("''We may fail on our own, but together, we shall prove victorious!''"),{{cite web|url=http://www.hazaeshaladas.hu/ftp/speech_of_mr_gordon_bajnai_-_23_october_2012.pdf|title=Gordon Bajnai's speech as published on the home page of his organization|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140116131232/http://www.hazaeshaladas.hu/ftp/speech_of_mr_gordon_bajnai_-_23_october_2012.pdf|archivedate=2014-01-16|df=}} when he proclaimed his support for such a "''cooperation between hopeful left-wingers, disappointed rightwingers, politically abandoned free-thinkers and committed Greens''" that his organization along with two other civilian body named [[Together 2014]] (later simply known as "Together") as a reference to the date of the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2014|next general election]] in Hungary.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-20052322|title=BBC News - Mass rallies mark 1956 Hungary uprising|work=BBC News|accessdate=14 February 2015}} In December 2012, Bajnai announced his intention to be a parliamentarian candidate in the 2014 general election.{{cite web|url=http://www.politics.hu/20121217/bajnai-says-plans-to-run-for-parliament-in-car-accident-in-budapest/|title=Bajnai says plans to run for Parliament; in car accident in Budapest|work=Politics.hu|accessdate=14 February 2015}} On 14 January 2014, five opposition parties entered into an electoral coalition and formed [[Unity (Hungary)|Unity]] alliance. In order to facilitate the creation of this alliance, Bajnai voluntarily gave up his candidacy of Prime Ministership, in favor of [[Attila Mesterházy]], the candidate of [[MSZP]], the largest party of this coalition.{{cite web |accessdate=2014-01-14|url=http://www.politics.hu/20140114/quotable-antal-rogan-on-the-opposition-coalition/|title=Quotable: Antal Rogan on the opposition coalition|date=2014-01-14}} Unity, under the leadership of [[Attila Mesterházy|Mesterházy]] suffered a heavy defeat in the April election, nevertheless Bajnai was elected to the National Assembly from the second place of the alliance's joint list. Bajnai resigned from his parliamentary seat on 26 May 2014, and gradually withdrawn himself from domestic politics. From September 2014, Gordon Bajnai returned to his original profession when he was named Group Chief Operating Officer of the [[Paris]]-based [[Meridiam]] infrastructure, a leading global investment fund.{{cite web |accessdate=2014-09-15|url=http://www.origo.hu/itthon/20140902-multicegnel-helyezkedik-el-bajnai-gordon.html|title=Multicégnél helyezkedik el Bajnai Gordon|date=2014-09-02}} Commentators on both the left and right political wing agreed that Bajnai was quitting politics with that step.{{cite web |accessdate=2014-09-15|url=http://www.origo.hu/itthon/20140915-veget-ert-bajnai-gordon-politikai-palyaja.html|title=Véget ért Bajnai Gordon politikai pályája|date=2014-09-15}} ==Personal life== Bajnai is currently in his second marriage. He has four children: Zsófia (1995), András (1998), Ágnes (2008) and Miklós (2012).{{cite web|url=http://24.hu/belfold/2013/10/27/megmutatta-gyermekeit-bajnai-gordon/|title=Megmutatta gyermekeit Bajnai Gordon|date=27 October 2013|publisher=}} Bajnai has played soccer from early childhood; he is one of the players of Hungarian football club Építők SK. Bajnai plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]]. According to the team's homepage the Prime Minister was the Footballer of the Year in 2001 at the club.{{cite web|url=http://epitoksk.uw.hu/|title=43. sz. Épít?k SK|publisher=|accessdate=14 February 2015}} In an occasion of a preparatory match against Grund FC in August 2011, he was seriously injured.[http://index.hu/belfold/2011/08/17/bajnai_gordont_durvan_fejen_rugtak/ Bajnai Gordont durván fejen rúgták] {{hu icon}} == Honors == In 1994 he was awarded Pro Universitate. In 1999 he was voted one of the 30 most promising Central-Eastern European business executives by the journal Central European Business Review. In 2003, the National Association of Managers selected Bajnai as the "Young Manager of the Year".[http://www.mfor.hu/cikkek/vallalatok/Bajnai_Gordon__a_Wallis_vezetoje_Az_ev_fiatal_menedzsere.html Bajnai Gordon, a Wallis vezetője Az év fiatal menedzsere] {{hu icon}} 2006 Officer's Cross [[Order of Merit of the Republic of Hungary]] (Civic Order of Merit) as an acknowledgement for his exceptional professional and company management work and his achievements in the area of company management culture development. ==See also== * [[Cabinet of Gordon Bajnai]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * Official web page: [http://www.bajnaigordon.hu www.bajnaigordon.hu] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090922151337/http://www.magyarorszag.hu/english magyarorszag.hu] {{S-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Mónika Lamperth]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Interior Minister of Hungary|Minister of Local Government]]|years=2007–2008}} {{s-aft|after=[[István Gyenesei]]}} {{s-bef|before=[[Csaba Kákosy]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Politics of Hungary|Minister of National Development and Economy]]|years=2008–2009}} {{s-aft|after=[[István Varga (politician, born 1956)|István Varga]]}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[Ferenc Gyurcsány]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Prime Minister of Hungary]]|years=2009–2010}} {{s-aft|after=[[Viktor Orbán]]}} {{s-end}} {{HungarianPrimeMinisters}} {{HungarianInteriorMinisters}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bajnai, Gordon}} [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hungarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of Hungary]] [[Category:Hungarian Interior Ministers]] [[Category:Together (Hungary) politicians]] [[Category:People from Szeged]] [[Category:Officer's Crosses of the Order of Merit of the Republic of Hungary (civil)]] [[Category:Corvinus University of Budapest alumni]] [[Category:Members of the National Assembly of Hungary (2014–18)]]

The '''International Electrical Congress''' was a series of international meetings, from 1881 - 1904, in the then new field of [[electrical engineering|applied electricity]]. The first meeting was initiated by the French government, including official national representatives, leading scientists, and others. Subsequent meetings also included official representatives, leading scientists, and others. Primary aims were to develop reliable standards, both in relation to electrical units and electrical apparatus.
==Historical background== In 1881, both within and across countries, different electrical units were being used. There were at least 12 different units of electromotive force, 10 different units of electric current and 15 different units of resistance.<ref name=Petley483>{{cite journal |last=Petley, B.W.|first= |date=1994-95 |title=A Brief History of the Electrical Units to 1964 |url=http://stacks.iop.org/0026-1394/31/i=6/a=007 |subscription=yes|journal=Metrologia |volume=31 |page=483 |doi= |author-link= }}</ref>
Other international Congresses were held, and sometimes referred to as International Electrical Congress, Electrical Conference, and similar variations. Secondary sources make different judgments about how to classify the Congresses. In this article, the Congresses with representatives from national governments are identified as ''International Electrical Congress''. Other Congresses — often addressing the same issues — are identified here as ''Concurrent Related International Electrical Congresses''. Some of these related conferences were devoted to preparing for an International Electrical Congress.
In 1906 the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]] was created.<ref>{{cite web |title = Overview: Summary |work = IEC History |publisher = International Electrotechnical Commission |url = http://www.iec.ch/about/history/overview |accessdate = 2018-04-19}}</ref> Congresses were organised under its auspices were also sometimes referred to as ''International Electrical Congress''. In this article, Congresses organized by the Commission are listed under ''International Electrotechnical Congresses'', while other related Congresses are listed under ''Related International Electrotechnical Conferences''.
==International Electrical Congress<ref name=IEC>{{Cite web |url=http://www.iec.ch/si/history/historical_background.htm|title=Historical background |access-date=10 April 2018|website=[[International Electrotechnical Commission]]}}</ref>== ===1881 in Paris=== Held from 15 September-5 October 1881, in connection with the [[International Exposition of Electricity]]. [[Adolphe Cochery]], Minister of Posts and Telegraphs of the French Government, was the Chairman.<ref name=Petley483/> At the Congress, [[William Thomson, 1st Baron Kelvin|William Thomson]] (United Kingdom), [[Hermann von Helmholtz]] (Germany), and {{ill|Gilbert Govi|it|Gilberto Govi (fisico)}} (Italy) were elected as foreign vice-presidents.<ref name=lagerstrom>{{cite thesis |last=Lagerstrom |first=L.R. |date=1992 |title=Constructing uniformity: The standardization of international electromagnetic measures, 1860-1912 |type=doctoral dissertation |chapter= |publisher=University of California, Berkeley |url= |access-date=}}p. 77 </ref> About 200-250 persons participated,<ref name=lagerstrom/> and a proceedings was published in 1882.<ref>{{cite book |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title= Congrès International des électriciens, Paris 1881|url=https://archive.org/details/congrsinternati38unkngoog|location=Paris |publisher=G. Masson |page= |date=1882 |isbn=}} (in French)</ref> Notable participants included: [[Hermann von Helmholtz|Helmholtz]], [[Rudolph Clausius|Clausius]], [[Gustav Kirchhoff |Kirchoff]], [[Werner Siemens]], [[Ernst Mach]], [[John William Strutt, 3rd Baron Rayleigh|Rayleigh]], and [[Heinrich Lenz| Lenz]], among others.<ref name=Tunbridge34>{{cite book | author=Tunbridge, P. | title=Lord Kelvin: His Influence on Electrical Measurements and Units | location=Peter Peregrinus | publisher=London | year=1992 |page=34 | isbn=0-86341-237-8|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bZUK624LZBMC}}</ref>
====Important events==== The three main topics for the Congress were: electrical units, improvements in international telegraphy, and various applications of electricity.<ref name=lagerstrom/> The Congress resolved to endorse the 1873 [[British Association for the Advancement of Science]] proposal<ref>{{cite conference |url= https://www.biodiversitylibrary.org/item/94452#page/7/mode/1up |title=First Report of the Committee for the Selection and Nomenclature of Dynamical and Electrical Units |date=1874|conference= Forty-third Meeting of the British Association for the Advancement of Science |publisher= John Murray |location= London |page = 223 |accessdate= 8 April 2018}} (Committee members: Professor [[Joseph David Everett]] (reporter), Sir W Thomson, Professor GC Foster, Professor JC Maxwell, Mr GJ Stoney, Professor Flemming Jenkin, Dr. CW Siemens, Mr FJ Bramwell)</ref> for defining the [[ohm]] and the [[volt]] as practical units,<ref name=Tunbridge35>{{cite book | author=Tunbridge, P. | title=Lord Kelvin: His Influence on Electrical Measurements and Units | location=Peter Peregrinus | publisher=London | year=1992 |pages=35-39 | isbn=0-86341-237-8|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bZUK624LZBMC}}</ref> and also made resolutions to define [[ampere]], [[coulomb]] and [[farad]],<ref name=IEC/> as units for current, quantity, and capacity respectively, to complete the practical system.<ref name=Tunbridge35/> It also resolved that an international committee should conduct new tests to determine the length of the column of mercury for measuring the ohm.
===1893 in Chicago=== Held from 21 - 25 August, in connection with the [[World's Columbian Exposition]], with almost 500 participants.<ref>{{cite encyclopedia |last=Martin|first=T.C.|contribution=History of the Congress|title=Proceedings of the International Electrical Congress held in the City of Chicago August 21st to 25th, 1893|date=1894|location=New York| page=xxii |publisher=American Institute of Electrical Engineers}}</ref> [[Elisha Gray]] was the Congress president. A proceedings was published.<ref>{{cite book |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title= Proceedings of the International Electrical Congress|url=https://archive.org/details/proceedingsinte01chicgoog|location=New York |publisher=American Institute of Electrical Engineers |page= |date=1894 |isbn=}}</ref>
: Refinements to the units of measurement, including the [[Clark cell]], were discussed.<ref>{{cite journal |author=Carhart, H.S. |date=18 Oct 1895 |title=Proceedings of the International Electrical Congress, Chicago, 1893 [review]|url=http://science.sciencemag.org/content/2/42/525 |journal=Science |volume=2 |issue=42|pages= 525-526 |doi=10.1126/science.2.42.525 |url-access=subscription|access-date=10 Apr 2018|bibcode=1895Sci.....2..525C}}</ref> Laid down rules for the physical representation: ohm, ampere and volt. Ohm and ampere were defined in terms of the [[CGS#CGS approach to electromagnetic units|CGS electromagnetic system]].<ref name=IEC/> The units were named ''international'' to distinguish them from the 1881 proposal, hence [[International System of Electrical and Magnetic Units]].{{cn|reason=hard to find clear support for label|date=April 2018}}
===1900 in Paris=== Held in 18-25 August in connection with the [[Paris Exposition Universelle]]. [[Éleuthère Mascart]] was the Congress President. There were more than 900 participants, about half of which were from France, and about 120 technical papers presented.<ref name=Tunbridge46>{{cite book | author=Tunbridge, P. | title=Lord Kelvin: His Influence on Electrical Measurements and Units | location=Peter Peregrinus | publisher=London | year=1992 |page=46 | isbn=0-86341-237-8|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bZUK624LZBMC}}</ref> A two-volume proceedings was published in 1901<ref name=1900report>{{cite book |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title= Congrès International d'électricité|url=https://archive.org/details/congrsinternati00hospgoog|location=Paris |publisher=Gauthier-Villars |page= |date=1901 |isbn=|language=fr}}</ref> : Dealt mainly with magnetic units.<ref name=IEC/> During this Congress, names were proposed for four magnetic-circuit units in the C.G.S. System. Only two were accepted by vote: the C.G.S. unit for [[magnetic flux]] ( '''{{math|Φ}}''') was named ''[[maxwell (unit)|maxwell]]'' and C.G.S. unit of [[magnetising force]] (or [[magnetic field intensity]]) was named ''[[gauss]]'' ('''H''').<ref name=Kennelly33-144/> Some delegates mistakenly believed and reported that the gauss was adopted as the C.G.S. unit of [[flux density]] ('''B''').<ref name=Kennelly33-144/> This mistake has been reproduced in contemporary texts,<ref name=Tunbridge46/> which have cited a mistaken report.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Kennelly |first=A.E. |date=5 March 1904 |volume=43|page=468|title=A historical sketch of International Electrical Congresses |url=https://archive.org/stream/electricalworld43newy#page/468/mode/1up |magazine=Electrical World and Engineer |location= |publisher= |access-date=20 April 2018}}</ref> It is relevant to note that the Congress's official formulation for the gauss was in French, ''{{lang|fr|champ magnetique}},''<ref>{{cite encyclopedia |author= |title= Congrès International d'électricité|chapter=Rapport de la Commission des Unités|url=https://archive.org/stream/congrsinternati00hospgoog#page/n395/mode/2up|location=Paris |publisher= |date= 1901 |isbn=|language=fr|page=384}}</ref> which would be translated into English as ''magnetic field'', which has been used to refer both to ('''B''') and ('''H'''), noted in [[Magnetic_field#Definitions,_units,_and_measurement|magnetic field]]. In 1930 the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]] decided that the magnetic [[Magnetic field#Definitions.2C units.2C and measurement|field strength]] ('''H''') was different from the [[Magnetic field#Definitions.2C units.2C and measurement|magnetic flux density]] ('''B'''), but now assigned the ''gauss'' to refer to magnetic flux density ('''B'''), in contrast to the decision from this Congress.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Kennelly |first1=A.E.|date=1933 |title=Conference of the Symbols, Units and Nomenclature (S. U. N.) Commission of the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (I. P. U.), at Paris, in July, 1932, and Its Results |url= |journal=Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America |volume=19 |issue=1 |page=146 |doi= |jstor=85786|access-date= }}</ref>
===1904 in [[St.Louis, Missouri]]=== Held from 12-17 September 1904, in connection with the [[Louisiana Purchase Exposition]]<ref>{{cite journal |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=29 Jul 1904 |title=The International Electrical Congress|url=http://science.sciencemag.org/content/20/500/156 |journal=Science |volume=20 |issue=500 |pages=156-157 |doi=10.1126/science.20.500.156 |access-date=10 Apr 2018|bibcode=1904Sci....20..156. }}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title=Transactions of the Transactions of the International Electrical Congress, St. Louis, 1904.|year=1905|publisher=J.B. Lyon|location=Albany, NY|url=https://catalog.hathitrust.org/Record/001616268/Home}}</ref> : Recommended two permanent international commissions, one about electrical units and standards, the other about unification of nomenclature and characteristics of electrical machines and apparatus.<ref name=IEC/> These recommendations are considered the seed that initiated the creation of the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]] in 1906.<ref name=founding>{{Cite web |url=http://www.iec.ch/si/history/founding_iec.htm|title=Founding of the IEC |access-date=13 April 2018|website=[[International Electrotechnical Commission]]}}</ref>
==Concurrent Related International Electrical Congresses== During the period that the Electrical Congresses were held, other conferences and international Congresses were held, sometimes in preparation to the official Electrical Congresses. These events are listed here.
===1882 in Paris===
''Conférence international pour la détermination des unités électriques'' (International Conference for Determination of Electrical Units)
Held 16-26 October. Was motivated by a resolution from the 1881 International Electrical Congress. A verbal transcript of the conference was published.<ref>{{cite book |title=Conférence international pour la détermination des unités électriques |date=1882 |author=Ministère des Affaires Étrangères |location=Paris | publisher=Imprimerie Nationale |url=https://archive.org/details/confrenceintern02trgoog |access-date=17 April 2018}} (in French).</ref>
===1884 in Paris=== ''International Conference for Determination of Electrical Units''
===1889 in Paris=== ''International Congress of Electricians'' Held 24-31 August, in connection with [[Exposition universelle de 1889]]. About 530 participants from at least 11 countries. : Adopted several units, including ''practical units'' of power (watt) and work (joule),<ref>{{Cite encyclopedia | title=Report of the United States Commissioners to the Universal Exposition of 1889 at Paris |url=https://archive.org/stream/cu31924107177093#page/n35/mode/2up|contribution=Congress |access-date=12 April 2018|pages=18-20|date=1891|location=Washington, DC|publisher=Government Printing Office}}</ref><ref name=Tunbridge42>{{cite book | author=Tunbridge, P. | title=Lord Kelvin: His Influence on Electrical Measurements and Units | location=Peter Peregrinus | publisher=London | year=1992 |page=42 | isbn=0-86341-237-8|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bZUK624LZBMC}}</ref> where 1 watt = 10<sup>7</sup> erg/second, and 1 joule = 10<sup>7</sup> erg.<ref name=K144>{{cite journal |journal=American Journal of Physics |doi= 10.1119/1.4826445|last=Jayson|first=J.S.|title=The Daniell Cell, Ohm’s Law and the Emergence of the International System of Units|arxiv=1512.07306v1|volume=82|date=2015|page=63|bibcode=2014AmJPh..82...60J}}</ref> Considered practical magnetic units, but did not make any resolutions or recommendations.<ref name=Kennelly33-144>{{cite journal |last1=Kennelly |first1=A.E.|date=1933 |title=Conference of the Symbols, Units and Nomenclature (S. U. N.) Commission of the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (I. P. U.), at Paris, in July, 1932, and Its Results |url= |journal=Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America |volume=19 |issue=1 |page=144 |doi=10.1073/pnas.19.1.144 |jstor=85786|access-date= |bibcode=1933PNAS...19..144K|pmc=1085894}}</ref>
===1891 in Frankfurt=== Held 7-12 September,<ref>{{cite journal|journal=Transactions of the American Institute of Electrical Engineers |last=Hering |first=Carl |title=Report of the delegation to the Frankfort electrical Congress |volume=8 |year=1891 |page= 544|doi=10.1109/T-AIEE.1891.5570160}}</ref> in connection with the [[International Electrotechnical Exhibition]]<ref name=Tunbridge42/> (Die Internationale Elektrotechnische Ausstellung 1891), organized by [[Elektrotechnische Gesellschaft]].<ref name=lagerstrom/> [[Galileo Ferraris]] was a vice-president at the conference.<ref>{{cite web|arxiv=1412.6981|title=Einstein and Besso: From Zürich to Milano|page=8|last=Bracco|first=Christian|date=2014|bibcode=2014arXiv1412.6981B}}</ref> There were 715 participants (473 from Germany and 243 from other countries, including Austria, United Kingdom, USA, and France).<ref name=L134>{{cite thesis | last=Lagerstrom | first=L.R. |date=1992 | title=Constructing uniformity: The standardization of international electromagnetic measures, 1860-1912|type=doctoral dissertation |chapter= |publisher=University of California, Berkeley}} p. 134</ref> An official report of the conference was published.<ref>International Elektrotechniker-Congress. ''Bericht uber die Verbandlungen der Hauptversammlungen''. Frankfurt am Main: Johannes Alt, 1892.</ref> : Papers and disucssions were organiszed in five main areas: Theory and Measuring Science; Strong Current Technology; Signalling, Telegraphy, and Telephony; Electrochemistry and Electric Current Applications; and Legislation to Mediate Conflicts between Cities around different currents used for electric lights, telephones, and telegraphs.<ref name=L134/><ref>{{cite web|title=Table of Contents of papers presented in the sections|url=http://www.gbv.de/dms/tib-ub-hannover/355198630.pdf|language=de|accessdate=21 April 2018}}</ref>
===1892 in Edinburgh=== Held in connection with the [[British Association for the Advancement of Science]] annual meeting<ref name=Tunbridge42/><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://ethw.org/System_of_Measurement_Units#Evolution_of_Electromagnetic_System_of_Units|title=System of measurement units|website=Engineering and Technology History Wiki|access-date=13 April 2018}}</ref>
===1896 in Geneva=== Held 4-9 August, in connection with the {{ill|Swiss National Exposition|de|Schweizerische_Landesausstellung#1896_in_Genf}}. Insufficient and late communication about the organization of the Congress hampered widespread participation, so that the conference had about 200 participants, mostly from Switzerland, Austria, Germany and Belgium.<ref name=LagerGenf/>
: Topics for discussion were magnetic units, photometric units, the long-distance transmission of power, the protection of high-tension lines against atmospheric discharge, and the problems and challenges of electric railway operation.<ref name=LagerGenf>{{cite thesis | last=Lagerstrom | first=L.R. |date=1992 | title=Constructing uniformity: The standardization of international electromagnetic measures, 1860-1912|type=doctoral dissertation |pages=198-200 |publisher=University of California, Berkeley}}</ref>
==International Electrotechnical Congress== ===1908 in London=== ''International Conference on Electric Units and Standards''. Held in October. Organized by the Commission on Electric Units and Standards of the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]]<ref name=founding/> : Formal adoption of the "international units" (e.g., international ohm, international ampere), which were proposed originally in the 1893 meeting of the International Electrical Congress in Chicago.<ref name=eb11-p742>{{cite encyclopedia | contribution = Units, Physical | title = Encyclopædia Britannica | volume = 27 | year = 1911 | edition = 11th |url=https://archive.org/stream/encyclopaediabri27chisrich#page/742/mode/1up| pages = 742}}</ref>
===1911 in Turin=== Held 10-17 September, organized by {{Interlanguage link multi|Associazione elettrotecnica italiana|it}} and the [[Italian Electrotechnical Committee]] of the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]]<ref name=Turin>{{cite journal |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=1911|title=The International Electrotechnical Congress of Turin|url=https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/stamp/stamp.jsp?arnumber=4768387 |journal=Transactions of the American Institute of Electrical Engineers |volume=30 |issue=3 |pages=2519 - 2533 |doi=10.1109/T-AIEE.1911.4768387 |access-date=10 Apr 2018}}</ref>
===1915 in San Francisco=== Was to be held 13-18 September, and organized by the [[American Institute of Electrical Engineers]],<ref>{{cite journal |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=1914 |title=International Electrical Congress, San Francisco, 1915 |url=https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&arnumber=6660692 |journal=Proceedings of the American Institute of Electrical Engineers |volume=33 |issue=7 |pages=216-217 |doi=10.1109/PAIEE.1914.6660692 |access-date=10 Apr 2018}}</ref> but was cancelled because of the outbreak of World War I.<ref>{{cite book | author=Tunbridge, P. | title=Lord Kelvin: His Influence on Electrical Measurements and Units | location=Peter Peregrinus | publisher=London | year=1992 |page=53 | isbn=0-86341-237-8|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bZUK624LZBMC}}</ref>
==Related International Electrotechnical Conferences==
===1905 in Berlin=== ''Internationale Konferenz über Elektrische Masseinheiten'' (International Conference on Electrical Units)
Held 23-25 October at [[Physikalisch-Technischen Reichsanstalt]] at [[Charlottenburg]]. The 1904 Congress recommended holding an international conference to address discrepancies in the electrical units and their interpretation. [[Emil Warburg]], president of the [[Physikalisch-Technische Reichsanstalt]] in Germany, invited representatives from corresponding national laboratories in the United States ([[National Bureau of Standards]]), the United Kingdom ([[National Physical Laboratory (United Kingdom)|National Physical Laboratory]]), and the official standards commissions in Austria and Belgium to an informal conference on electrical standards and units.<ref name=L244>{{cite thesis |last=Lagerstrom |first=L.R. |date=1992 |title=Constructing uniformity: The standardization of international electromagnetic measures, 1860-1912 |type=doctoral dissertation |chapter= |publisher=University of California, Berkeley |url= |access-date=}}pp. 243-244</ref> Additionally Mascart (France), Rayleigh (United Kingdom) and [[Henry Smith Carhart |Carhart]] (USA) were invited because of their expertise and influence.<ref name=L244/> Thirteen of the fifteen invited persons participated in the conference, six from the Reichsanstalt, two from the Belgian Commission on Electrical Units, two from the Austrian Commission on Standardization, [[Richard Glazebrook]] from the National Physical Laboratory, Mascart, and Carhart. The non-attendees were [[Samuel Wesley Stratton]], director of the National Bureau of Standard, who sent three papers outlining the positions and proposals of the Bureau, and Rayleigh.<ref>{{cite thesis |last=Lagerstrom |first=L.R. |date=1992 |title=Constructing uniformity: The standardization of international electromagnetic measures, 1860-1912 |type=doctoral dissertation |chapter= |publisher=University of California, Berkeley |url= |access-date=}}p. 245</ref> A proceedings was published.<ref>{{cite book |title=Verhandlungen der Internationalen konferenz über elektrische masseinheiten abgehalten in der Physikalischtechnischen reichsanstalt zu Charlottenburg vom 23. bis 25. oktober 1905 |date=1906 |author=Internationale Konferenz über Elektrische Masseinheiten |publisher=Reichsdruckerei |url=https://books.google.com?id=TKD2ZwEACAAJ |access-date=17 April 2018}}</ref>
: Concentrated on the redefinition of the ohm, ampere, and volt, as resolved in the 1904 Congress. The aim was to attain true international uniformity in definitions of these concepts.<ref>{{cite thesis |last=Lagerstrom |first=L.R. |date=1992 |title=Constructing uniformity: The standardization of international electromagnetic measures, 1860-1912 |type=doctoral dissertation |chapter= |publisher=University of California, Berkeley |url= |access-date=}}p. 351 </ref> The main question was whether ''ohm'', ''ampere'', and ''volt'' should be independent of each other, or only two should be defined, and which two.<ref name=Tunbridge49>{{cite book | author=Tunbridge, P. | title=Lord Kelvin: His Influence on Electrical Measurements and Units | location=Peter Peregrinus | publisher=London | year=1992 |pages=49-51| isbn=0-86341-237-8|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bZUK624LZBMC}}</ref> The conference concluded that only two electrical units should be taken as fundamental: the [[Ohm#international ohm|international ohm]] and the [[international ampere]].<ref name=Tunbridge49/> It also adopted the Western Cadmium Cell as the standard cell,<ref name=Tunbridge49/> and added rules about the preparation and use of the mercury tube, whose geometry was specified at the 1893 Congress.<ref>{{cite thesis |last=Lagerstrom |first=L.R. |date=1992 |title=Constructing uniformity: The standardization of international electromagnetic measures, 1860-1912 |type=doctoral dissertation |chapter= |publisher=University of California, Berkeley |url= |access-date=}}p. 247</ref> The conference resolved that another international conference in the course of a year should be held to establish an agreement about the electric standards in use, because different countries had different laws about electrical units.<ref name=Tunbridge49/>
===1908 in Marseille=== Held 14-19 September, in connection with the L'exposition internationale des applications de l'électricité.<ref name=Turin/> A three-volume proceedings was published.<ref>{{cite book |author= |title= Congrès international des applications de l'électricité Marseille (3 vol.)|url= |publisher=Gauthier-Villars |page= |date=1909 |location=Paris|language=fr}}</ref>
